decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with mana dorks like Paradise Druid and Llanowar Elves, then dropping powerful threats such as Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis to overwhelm the opponent. Key cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shalai, Voice of Plenty provide protection for your creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The Immortal Sun is included to increase the efficiency of your creatures and draw additional cards. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using efficient removal spells and disruptive cards to control the board while also pressuring the opponent with aggressive creatures. By disrupting the opponent's hand with Thought Erasure, stealing cards with Thief of Sanity, and bouncing threats with Teferi, Time Raveler, it aims to slow down the opponent's game plan. At the same time, it can quickly build a wide board presence with Hero of Precinct One and outvalue the opponent with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck seeks to maintain control of the game while putting pressure on the opponent to secure a win.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Viashino Pyromancer, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Chandra, Fire Artisan, along with plenty of efficient burn spells such as Lightning Strike and Shock, the deck aims to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. Additionally, cards like Experimental Frenzy and Light Up the Stage provide card advantage and help maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck's goal is to maintain a fast pace and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lazav's ability to copy creatures in the graveyard and create a powerful combo that allows for quick mill victory. By milling through the deck quickly with cards like Diligent Excavator and Chamber Sentry, combined with Jace's ability to win the game if the library is empty, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden win condition. The deck includes ways to protect the combo pieces with Teferi, Time Raveler and also includes cards like Mox Amber and Teshar, Ancestor's Apostle to help ramp up and consistently execute the combo.

This Bant Aggro deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with creatures like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, allowing for powerful plays early on. Nissa, Who Shakes the World and The Immortal Sun provide additional mana ramp and power boosts to all creatures. Shalai, Voice of Plenty and Trostani Discordant offer protection and lifegain, while Hydroid Krasis provides card draw and a large flying threat. Prison Realm and Teferi, Time Raveler help control the board, while Finale of Glory can overwhelm opponents with a sudden influx of tokens. This deck aims to be fast-paced and aggressive, with the ability to quickly close out games.

The primary focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to maintain dominance over the game through card advantage and powerful, proactive spells. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, as well as disruptive spells like Syncopate and Deafening Clarion, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and outvalue its opponents. The inclusion of cards like The Immortal Sun and Nexus of Fate provide additional longevity and inevitability, ensuring that the deck can outlast and outmaneuver opposing strategies in order to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost and efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing aggressive creatures like Viashino Pyromancer and Goblin Chainwhirler, along with direct damage spells like Wizard's Lightning and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent early and often. The inclusion of cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy allows for explosive turns and card advantage, while Chandra, Fire Artisan provides additional reach and card draw. This deck aims to close out games swiftly and decisively.

This Red Deck Wins is built to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of cheap burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on cheap spells like Shock and Lightning Strike to clear the opponent's board and keep the pressure on with creatures like Viashino Pyromancer and Goblin Chainwhirler. Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy help to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on while Chandra, Fire Artisan provides a powerful late-game threat. The deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, and Incubation Druid in order to play powerful control spells like Mass Manipulation and Entrancing Melody. It also features creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Tolsimir, Friend to Wolves for added value and protection. The deck aims to control the game by stealing opponent's creatures, generating card advantage, and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats while maintaining a solid mana base to support its strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells in order to control the board and maintain advantage. The Golgari color combination provides a mix of removal, ramp, and card advantage. Key cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Nissa, Who Shakes the World help keep the pressure on the opponent while cards like Assassin's Trophy and Casualties of War deal with threats. Vraska, Golgari Queen and Liliana, Dreadhorde General provide additional value and versatility to the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to establish dominance early and maintain control throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to stall and control the game using Jeskai Planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Dovin. By using their abilities to bounce, draw cards, and counter spells, the deck aims to prevent the opponent from gaining advantage while setting up a win condition with cards like Sarkhan the Masterless and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. The deck includes removal spells like Shock and Deafening Clarion to handle threats on the board, while cards like Opt and Anticipate help dig for key pieces. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells while also utilizing the power of dragons. The deck focuses on playing creatures with haste and powerful abilities like Gruul Spellbreaker and Rekindling Phoenix to apply pressure early in the game. With cards like Shock and Lightning Strike, as well as planeswalkers like Sarkhan the Masterless and Chandra, Fire Artisan, the deck can also deal direct damage to the opponent. The inclusion of dragons like Sarkhan and creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher adds a powerful late-game threat to ensure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells. Cards like Viashino Pyromancer and Goblin Chainwhirler deal damage on entry, while cards like Wizard's Lightning and Lightning Strike target creatures or players directly. Runaway Steam-Kin powers up as you cast red spells, allowing for explosive turns. Experimental Frenzy lets you cast cards from the top of your library, maintaining a steady stream of threats. Chandra, Fire Artisan provides additional burn damage and card advantage. Overall, the strategy is to be aggressive and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main strategy of this deck is to establish early mana ramp with Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, leading into powerful Simic threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Frilled Mystic and steal opponent's creatures with Mass Manipulation and Entrancing Melody. With efficient mana base and card draw engines, the deck aims to outvalue opponent and overwhelm them with big creatures.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful Simic cards to generate mana and draw cards, while also countering opponent's threats. With the ability to ramp up quickly with mana dorks like Paradise Druid and Llanowar Elves, the goal is to play big threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis ahead of curve. Tamiyo, Collector of Tales helps with card selection and protection, while Nexus of Fate allows for extra turns to seal victory. Overall, the deck aims to out-value opponents and dominate the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers and removal spells while generating card advantage and stability through efficient creatures and mana ramp. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Assassin's Trophy and Command the Dreadhorde, while also ramping into powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis. By effectively managing resources and utilizing various card advantage engines, the deck seeks to outvalue and outlast opponents in a grindy matchup.
